rktoolkit.visualizers package

Visualizers package contains classes for visualising the RK model into a RK-Diagram.

Circular Visualizer

class rktoolkit.visualizers.circular.CircularVisualizer(spec: Optional[CircularVisualizerSpec] = None, *args, **kwargs)

Bases: RKModelVisualizer

Cicular Visualizer visualizes an RKModel by plotting clusters and measures in a circular pattern in 3D space

It assumes the RKModel is at least in 3d TODO: Visualizer only gives locations and specs. RK-Diagram Renderer renders the specs

_build(model: List[RKModel])

Builds a Visualization of the RKModel.

Parameters

Raises

e – If RKModel is unable to be created, returns an exception.

An RKDiagram visualization .

Returns

Return type

_plot_children(parent, mask=None, level=1)

Plots a first level child of an rkmodel

The first level child is positioned in a cicular pattern, incrementing rads through the position in the list.

The entire RKModel must be built out so the spacing can be determined between clusters.Plots a first level child of an rkmodel

The first level child is positioned in a cicular pattern, incrementing rads through the position in the list.

The entire RKModel must be built out so the spacing can be determined between clusters.

Parameters

  • parent (Any) – Parent node (Starting node) from where the children should be plotted.

  • mask (GraphMask, optional) – Any child nodes to be masked, defaults to None

  • level (int, optional) – Child nodes level, defaults to 1

Raises

ValueError – Raises a ValueError if Parent node’s position hasn’t been placed i.e, not in positions list.

Plots the links between the nodesplots the links between the nodes

Parameters

  • mask (GraphMask, optional) – Nodes that are/need to be masked, defaults to None

Raises

class rktoolkit.visualizers.circular.CircularVisualizerSpec(center_color='#000000', center_size=300, distance_from_center=10, cluster_size=10, add_node_labels=False, alpha=0.5)

Bases: object

These are specs for the circular visualiation They define how close the clsuters are to the centroid, the size of the centroid bubble, alpha, etc.

You can compute these dynamically or use static fields. Initialization specs are:

:param center_color: Color for center in unicode, defaults to '#000000'
:type center_color: str 
:param center_size:  Size of the center node, defaults to 300
:type center_size: int
:param distance_from_center: Distance of nodes from center, defaults to 10.
:type distance_from_center: int
:param cluster_size: Size of the cluster, defaults to 10.
:type cluster_size: int
:param add_node_labels: To check if nodes need to be labelled or not,defaults to False.
:type add_node_labels: bool
:param alpha: Alpha index value, defaults to .5.
:type alpha: float

Base Visualizers

class rktoolkit.visualizers.visualizer.Arrow3D(xs, ys, zs, *args, **kwargs)

Bases: FancyArrowPatch

Builds arrows in 3D. Uses matplotlib’s FancyArrowPatch class to draw the 3D arrows.

draw(renderer)

Implements the FancyArrowPatch’s draw method to draw the arrows.

Parameters

renderer (RendererBase) – Renderer used for the arrows used by FancyArrowPatch to plot.

set(*, agg_filter=<UNSET>, alpha=<UNSET>, animated=<UNSET>, antialiased=<UNSET>, arrowstyle=<UNSET>, capstyle=<UNSET>, clip_box=<UNSET>, clip_on=<UNSET>, clip_path=<UNSET>, color=<UNSET>, connectionstyle=<UNSET>, edgecolor=<UNSET>, facecolor=<UNSET>, fill=<UNSET>, gid=<UNSET>, hatch=<UNSET>, in_layout=<UNSET>, joinstyle=<UNSET>, label=<UNSET>, linestyle=<UNSET>, linewidth=<UNSET>, mouseover=<UNSET>, mutation_aspect=<UNSET>, mutation_scale=<UNSET>, patchA=<UNSET>, patchB=<UNSET>, path_effects=<UNSET>, picker=<UNSET>, positions=<UNSET>, rasterized=<UNSET>, sketch_params=<UNSET>, snap=<UNSET>, transform=<UNSET>, url=<UNSET>, visible=<UNSET>, zorder=<UNSET>)

Set multiple properties at once.

Supported properties are

Properties:

agg_filter: a filter function, which takes a (m, n, 3) float array and a dpi value, and returns a (m, n, 3) array and two offsets from the bottom left corner of the image alpha: scalar or None animated: bool antialiased or aa: bool or None arrowstyle: str or matplotlib.patches.ArrowStyle capstyle: .CapStyle or {‘butt’, ‘projecting’, ‘round’} clip_box: .Bbox clip_on: bool clip_path: Patch or (Path, Transform) or None color: color connectionstyle: [ ‘arc3’ | ‘angle3’ | ‘angle’ | ‘arc’ | ‘bar’ ] edgecolor or ec: color or None facecolor or fc: color or None figure: .Figure fill: bool gid: str hatch: {‘/’, ‘\’, ‘|’, ‘-’, ‘+’, ‘x’, ‘o’, ‘O’, ‘.’, ‘*’} in_layout: bool joinstyle: .JoinStyle or {‘miter’, ‘round’, ‘bevel’} label: object linestyle or ls: {‘-’, ‘–’, ‘-.’, ‘:’, ‘’, (offset, on-off-seq), …} linewidth or lw: float or None mouseover: bool mutation_aspect: float mutation_scale: float patchA: .patches.Patch patchB: .patches.Patch path_effects: .AbstractPathEffect picker: None or bool or float or callable positions: unknown rasterized: bool sketch_params: (scale: float, length: float, randomness: float) snap: bool or None transform: .Transform url: str visible: bool zorder: float

class rktoolkit.visualizers.visualizer.RKDiagram(rkmodel: RKModel, placed_nodes, links)

Bases: object

An RKDiagram is the manifestation of an RK-Model

It contains the positions of each node, information about how to represent such nodes, as well as edge visualizations.

It is purely a visualization diagram. To work effectively, the visualized space must be in nD < 4

Uses pyplot to create the visualization diagram.

render()
class rktoolkit.visualizers.visualizer.RKModelVisualizer(ax=None, fig=None)

Bases: object

Base class for RK models Visualizes a model as an RK-Diagram. Uses pyplot for the visualization.

build(models: RKModel)

Method to build the visualization for the RKModel.

Parameters

models (RKModel) – RKModel whose RK-Diagram needs to built.

render()

Method to render a RKDiagram. Utilizes the pyplot.show() method.

Utilities Module for Visualizers

rktoolkit.visualizers.util.draw_graph(G, ax=None, with_labels=True, minsize=100, alpha=300, emult=2, make_axis=False, width=6.283185307179586)

Method to draw a general graph of an ontology that is transformed using BaseOntologyTransform. Refer to HTG transformers for information on Base Ontology Transform.

Parameters

  • G (Graph) – Transformed Graph to be drawn

  • ax (Axes, optional) – Axes to be used for the graph, defaults to None

  • with_labels (bool, optional) – Parameter to choose if labels need to be shown or not, defaults to True

  • minsize (int, optional) – Minimum size of the graph nodes, defaults to 100

  • alpha (int, optional) – Alpha index for the graph, defaults to 300

  • emult (int, optional) – No. of emulations, defaults to 2

  • make_axis (bool, optional) – Should axes be made in graph or not, defaults to False

  • width (float, optional) – Width of the nodes in graph, defaults to 2*math.pi

rktoolkit.visualizers.util.draw_rk_diagram(rkmodel, spread=1, ax=None, with_labels=True, minsize=100, center_color='green', alpha=300, emult=2, make_axis=False, width=6.283185307179586, xoff=0, yoff=0, color_override=None)

Method to draw an RK diagram for a given RK Model. Refer to RK-Model<rktoolkit.models.rkmodel> for more information.

Parameters

  • rkmodel (RKModel) – RK model to be drawn a RK Diagram for.

  • spread (int, optional) – Spread amount for the model, defaults to 1

  • ax (Axes, optional) – Axes to be used, defaults to None

  • with_labels (bool, optional) – Parameter to choose if labels need to be shown or not, defaults to True

  • minsize (int, optional) – Minimum size of the nodes, defaults to 100

  • center_color (str, optional) – Color of the center node, defaults to ‘green’

  • alpha (int, optional) – Alpha index of the graph, defaults to 300

  • emult (int, optional) – No of emulations, defaults to 2

  • make_axis (bool, optional) – Parameter to choose if axes should be made in the model or not, defaults to False

  • width (float, optional) – Width of the nodes, defaults to 2*math.pi

  • xoff (int, optional) – Offset of X-axis, defaults to 0

  • yoff (int, optional) – Offset of Y-axis, defaults to 0

  • color_override (str, optional) – Colors which needs to be overriden, defaults to None
